headline: Supermarket giant Morrisons explores £1bn property deal
summary: Morrisons, the UK's fifth-largest supermarket chain, is exploring a £1bn property deal amid its battle to recapture the ground it has lost to rivals including Sainsbury's and Aldi.  Sky News has learnt that Morrisons, which is based in Bradford, West Yorkshire, has engaged the real estate advisory firm CBRE to evaluate options for raising finance secured against part of its large freehold store portfolio.  One option expected to be considered is a medium- or long-term borrowing deal secured against a number of Morrisons' supermarkets.
